meta_description: Explore Southern Appalachian heritage at Foxfire Village Museum & Mercantile, with educational programs, preserved cabins, classes and events.
hours_text:
## 

Visit Foxfire Village Museum, a perfect family-friendly day trip and destination, just under two hours from Atlanta, Asheville, Greenville, and Knoxville. Situated on over 100 acres of scenic mountainside next to Black Rock Mountain State Park, the museum offers a chance to step back in time and explore Appalachian life from 1820 to 1940.

You can check our [Hours & Information](https://www.foxfire.org/visit-foxfire-village-museum/the-foxfire-museum-mercantile/), explore our [classes and events](https://www.foxfire.org/events/), and [read](https://www.foxfire.org/events/) what others have come to love about Foxfire.

collections_text:
# Welcome to Foxfire

We can’t wait to welcome you to the Foxfire Village Museum and Mercantile

###### Preserving the past, welcoming the future

Foxfire began in 1966 as a student-created magazine that captured the voices and traditions of Southern Appalachian life. It soon became a bestselling book series, and the royalties helped purchase the land that is now home to the Foxfire Village Museum and Mercantile.  
  
Today, Foxfire remains dedicated to preserving the stories and skills of Appalachia. Through our educational programs, museum, hands-on classes, publications, and events, we keep these traditions alive and share them with future generations.

Want to take a piece of Foxfire home? Explore our online Mercantile for handcrafted goods, Foxfire publications, and one-of-a-kind treasures that celebrate Appalachian folklife.
